News

New Eye Library taking shape

Written by Leon Paternoster · Published Oct 31, 2018

The new Eye Library celebrated it’s ‘topping out’ ceremony last week, where representatives from Suffolk Libraries, Suffolk County Council and Design and Property Consultants Concertus came together to make the occasion and take a look round the new library.

County reserve closed (some older and specialised titles not available)

Written by Leon Paternoster · Published Oct 31, 2018

We're currently unable to provide books from the county reserve in Lowestoft Library due to the lift being out of service.

October half-term events at Suffolk Libraries

Written by Alice Violett · Published Oct 11, 2018

We've got all sorts of exciting events and activities for children across our libraries this half-term.

Suffolk Libraries offering free sanitary items to help fight period poverty

Written by Sarah Lungley · Published Oct 8, 2018

Suffolk Libraries is piloting providing free sanitary items, no questions asked, in ten different libraries.

Libraries Week 2018

Written by James Powell · Published Oct 8, 2018

Libraries Week takes place between 8–13 October to celebrate the nation’s libraries. This year, it focuses on wellbeing and how libraries bring communities together, combat loneliness, provide a space for reading and creativity and support people with their mental health.

Bringing Sutton Hoo to life in the library

Written by James Powell · Published Oct 4, 2018

Suffolk Libraries is pleased to be working with Sutton Hoo to host a series of roadshows over the next few months while the world famous site is closed for major development work.

Calling all young people: BLOC out your diaries for these taster days!

Written by James Powell · Published Oct 3, 2018

Suffolk Libraries is calling for young people across the county to have their say and help shape the Suffolk Libraries Arts Programme – BLOC.

Lesley’s Readers on BBC Radio Suffolk – book choice for October

Written by Alice Violett · Published Oct 2, 2018

This month Lesley will be discussing The Burnt-Out Town of Miracles, by Roy Jacobsen.

Fun Palace events to kick off National Libraries Week

Written by James Powell · Published Oct 2, 2018

Several Suffolk libraries will be hosting Fun Palaces this weekend (Saturday 6 and Sunday 7 October).

Ipswich County Library set for Americana showcase

Written by James Powell · Published Oct 1, 2018

Ipswich County Library’s growing reputation as a live music venue will be enhanced further on Saturday 13 October when the venue hosts a trio of top Americana acts.
